dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling SKUNK, 11 now, as she makes her way home from the local shop carrying a sliced pan and a carton of milk. She makes her way down several STREETS, crosses a ROAD.

dialogues.text: who is a little over halfway across now.

dialogues.text: nods to his brother, HARRY. HARRY swings a plastic bag filled with a dark substance around in circles, faster an faster, before letting it fly. It sails up toward SKUNK, then misses her by inches, continuing its trajectory toward -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY

I’m fine.” That’s it; that’s all you bloody get! (takes a drink of whiskey. PAUSE; then) I’m really sorry to just drop in on you like this, Archie, out of the blue, it’s...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Hey ...

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: «+. I just thought, “Archie! He’s a solicitor ...”

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Right. So, what, do you want to make this a legal thing, Dave?

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Are you joking? I’m just saying, I thought you'd be a good listener ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Ah.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: «+. Which you are. No, no. Bloody legal action? Forget it. I want nothing more to do with that bastard.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Oswald.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Why not?  21.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: ‘Cos I’m scared of him, Archie. Why else ...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK, on the stairs, listens through the slightly open doorway. MR BUCKLEY (0.S; CONT’D) «+. I’m just really bloody scared of him.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Rick ...? 34 INT. RICK’S BEDROOM - DAY 34 RICK sits on the edge of his bed, staring at the wall. Fr outside the door, MRS BUCKLEY continues: MRS BUCKLEY (0.S; CONT’D) «+. Do you remember that time we were up at the lakes and you went under the water ...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS BUCKLEY, wearing a dressing gown and looking a little strung-out, sits on a chair outside RICK’s bedroom. MRS BUCKLEY (CONT’D) «+. Five years old and your father ran so fast across those stones to get you, and then he got you... (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He saved you. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we had to go to the A & E, you remember? Not for you, you were fine, but for him, because he’d cut his feet up running over the stones. (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, then ... The doorbell rings. 36 36 INT. BUCKLEY’S HALLWAY MRS BUCKLEY opens the door, revealing SKUNK.  37 38 22.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Hi, Mrs Buckley. Is Rick in?

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: I dunno. I thought he might like to play or something?

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: He’s ill. He can’t see you, Skunk.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Okay. Well ...

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Bye-bye now, love. She closes the door. BEAT. SKUNK walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK stands at the window, watching SKUNK head back to he house. From outside the door, we hear:

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That was Skunk, Rick ... (PAUSE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... She wanted to see how you were ... (PAUSE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. Isn’t that nice? RICK continues to watch SKUNK’s departure. MRS BUCKLEY (0.S; CONT’D) ... Anyway, then we bought you a matchbox tank for being so brave and you tried to give it to your dad, you remember? So good, you were ...! So generous ...! I mean, what five year old in the world would do that ...?! 38 INT. OSWALDS’ HOUSE Pulling BOB down the HALLWAY to the front door, which he opens revealing -

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Hello, Archie.  23.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Bob.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I was wondering if we could have a chat.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: A chat?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Absolutely. He folds his arms and waits.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Well ... (sighs; BEAT) ... I’m aware that things have been tough for you since Barbara passed away; for you, for the irls, and, I suppose I just wanted to say, what, with all that’s been happening lately, that if, you know, you ever need to talk ...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Talk?!

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: »».- about ... Yeah, about ...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Fuck off, Archie, will you?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: All right. All right. Well, to ask you, then, if you could ask your girls to give the Buckleys a break. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They’re having a pretty hard time of it at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Are they?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: That’s really awful! (PAUSE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When’s the last time you cried, Archie?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Cried?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Why?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Cos the next time you will is the next time you criticise my girls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ina...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Bob ...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Hang on. ... in any fucking way whatsoever. All right? They’re out of bounds. And if Buckley can’t even take a little friendly fucking ribbing, then he’s a more pathetic prick than I thought. Now, I’m having my dinner, so if you don’t mind fucking off, mate? Thanks. He slams the door. HOLD on ARCHIE. INT. SKUNK’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 39 Once again, we see -

dialogues.speaker: THE NEEDLE
dialogues.text: pricking SKUNK’s finger, drawing blood.

dialogues.speaker: HER FINGER
dialogues.text: pressing down on the TEST STRIP, leaving a blood-deposit.

dialogues.speaker: THE TEST STRIP
dialogues.text: being put into the meter. The numerical reading.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: in bed, writing this number into a log-book. As she does Kasia  40 25. pops her head into the room -

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Close your curtains, Skunk. and is gone. SKUNK closes the log-book, goes to the curtains, but, before she can close them, she sees, acros the square -—

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: standing in his window again, looking directly at her.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: raises her hand, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: backs away from his window and disappears out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: Sound of a DOORBELL RINGING, then KASIA’S VOICE calling: KASIA’S VOICE It’s Mi-ike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KASIA opens the front door and MIKE KIERNAN (30s) enters.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Hi. They look at each other a moment, then kiss tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Gross. SKUNK and JED are standing down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, guys.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: What did you bring us?  41 26. INT. KITCHEN 4l There are which sit KASIA has She sighs. sweets, crisps and drinks on the table, around SKUNK, JED, KASIA and MIKE, playing a board game. surreptitiously moved her piece forward.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (to KASIA) No, no. Put it back. Put it back. D’you see what she’s doing?!

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Kasia!

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: (guilty) What?!

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: We saw you.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Come on. Put it back and go again, please. Obeys.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s it. There are rules for a reason, isn’t that right, Jed?

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Mike? When you’re a teacher, will you still, like, bring us treats and stuff?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No.That’1l1 all have to end, Skunk.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean, the relationship between student and teacher, by nature ...

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: But, you won’t be our teacher.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You never know...  27.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Mike.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: “By nature” is what?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: .-. is adversarial.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It means that it’1ll be my job to see you as, I suppose, the enemy, someone worthy only of my distrust ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: «+. my contempt ...

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: He’s full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Mike?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m not. (continuing; to SKUNK) «+. And you'll begin to see me that way as well. Who’s go is it?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Yours.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: I won’t ever see you that way, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: (picking up the dice) That’s because you’re in love with him.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (blushing) No, I’m not.  42 43 28.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: In my experience, Jed, the person who brings up the subject of love is, more often than not, the person who’s in love.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Exactly! Who’re you in love with, Jed?

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: (also blushing) Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: You're blushing, Jed.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Shut up! Are you two in love?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Me and Mike? Of course.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Then, why aren’t you married yet ...? He throws the dice, begins moving his piece; half to himself:

dialogues.speaker: JED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .-. That’s the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK walks, JED skateboards.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: .-. Also, sometimes, as they pass, the older kids’1l punch you ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: «+. in the stomach. Or spit on you.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Why would they spit on me ...?!  29. A boy ploughs through them on a bicycle. This is DILLON (13), a skinny urchin type. In trying to avoid them, he loses control and falls.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Shit! You all right, mate?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Look at what you made me do ...

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Me?!

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: «+. Idiot!

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Listen: It’s not our fault you can’t ride your bike.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: (getting up) It’s not my bike.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Whose it is?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: I dunno. I nicked it from the outside the one-stop, didn’t I? Check this out, you ready? He cycles in circles a moment, then tries to pop a wheeli The front wheel rises about an inch off the ground. SKUNK laughs. JED shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: That’s a travesty.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Hang on, hang on. All right, you ready? He tries again, this time doing a good, high one, which last several seconds. But, when the wheel touches down, t handlebars twist and he is flung over them. JED and SKUNK run over to help. As they do -

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Hey ...! a BURLY MAN comes running down the street. BURLY MAN (CONT’D) «+. Thieving little bastards, I’1l kill you!  44 30.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Run. He runs, picking up his skateboard as he passes it.

dialogues.speaker: BURLY MAN
dialogues.text: I’1l kill you!

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Come on. She helps DILLON up. They run.

dialogues.speaker: BURLY MAN
dialogues.text: I'll bloody kill you ...! When he arrives at his bike, he comes to a stop. Then - BURLY MAN (CONT’D) «+. Twats! SPLAT! He is hit on the shoulder by a plastic bag full of SHIT which, on impact, splashes all over him. He stops, stunned. The BARLOW BROTHERS, who we met at the beginning, glide past on their scooters behind him, laughing. He touches his face -

dialogues.speaker: BURLY MAN
dialogues.text: What the fuck ...?! looks at the shit on his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: BURLY MAN
dialogues.text: Uuuuuuugh, what the fuck ...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just off the street. SKUNK, JED and DILLON come running down it. As they come to a stop, breathless, scared, exhilarated:

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Shit. That was like, proper danger, wasn’t it ...?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: ... Like real adrenaline shit! Having regained his breath, he takes out a cigarette, put it in his mouth.  31.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Oh, mate ...!

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Cigarettes are a death warrant.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Well ... You make your choices, don’t you. JED lights up. DILLON looks at him. Then, nodding sagely:

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: I suppose you do.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: We have X-box.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Yeah? What games you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK, JED and DILLON walk.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: So, who do you live with, then?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: My Auntie.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Where’s your dad?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: He’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Dead?!

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: He was killed in a fire along with my mum...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: «+. and my sister. I don’t give a shit. I was only five or six at the time ...

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Wow!  32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the three emerge from the ALLEY:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Our mum ran away with an accountant from Manchester.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Yeah? So, are you a lesbian?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: You look like a lesbian.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: What does a lesbian look like?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Kind of ugly. Before SKUNK can react, all three stop, seeing -

dialogues.speaker: TWO POLICE CARS
dialogues.text: outside the BUCKLEY house. Two POLICEMEN confer with an upset MRS BUCKLEY. Several NEIGHBOURS also stand about, watching.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK, JED AND DILLON
dialogues.text: pass on the other side of the close, watching as another two POLICEMEN come out of Buckley’s house with RICK betwe them, hands cuffed behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE AND SASKIA OSWALD
dialogues.text: bounce on their trampoline, calling:

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: Get the straightjacket!

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Lock him up!

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: Put him in a padded fucking cell, the psycho.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Cut his knob off!

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: Feed it to him!  33.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: His donkey’s fucking knob! EE-ORR
They laugh. SUSAN, who stands in front of the trampoline, only smiles distractedly.

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICEMEN
dialogues.text: put RICK into the back of the car.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK, JED AND DILLON
dialogues.text: are now outside the CUNNINGHAM house, still watching as a AMBULANCE arrives and pulls up outside the BUCKLEY’s. The police car pulls away. Inside -

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: watches SKUNK as they pass.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: misses him because her attention has now been taken by -

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: who has just come out of his house, supported by a POLICEMAN, his arm in a makeshift sling, blood all over h shirt.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: It’s nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: It’s non-life threatening.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Look at the blood!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Inside, come on. SKUNK and JED turn to see KASIA at their front door.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Is Rick gone mental?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Shut up and get inside. This kind of thing isn’t for ... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KASIA (cont'd) (to DILLON) Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: He’s coming in to play X-Box.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: No, he’s not. (to DILLON) Bye-bye now, sonny. Off you go back to your halting-site.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: I’m no pikey!

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: That’s racist, Kasia. (to DILLON) Sorry, mate. She’s Polish. JED follows KASIA inside. SKUNK remains. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: You don’t look like a lesbian.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: No? So, why’d you say I did?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: ‘Cos I’m ugly?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: You’re not. You’re really pretty.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Am I?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: (PAUSE; then) Nah, you’re ugly. See ya! He goes. She watches him a moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: KASIA, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Skunk!!! She turns, goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So, what happened?  35. 46 INT. CUNNINGHAM’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 46 ARCHIE sits with MR BUCKLEY, who has his arm in a sling. Again, they have whiskeys in front of them. After a momen

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Well, Doris and I, we’d been, um (sighs, then) «+. Well, we’d been fighting ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: «+. I mean, really fighting. I was so bloody angry with her ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR and MRS BUCKLEY, who is still in her dressing-gown.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: ... don’t know whether you’re coming or going, look at you! When did you last have a shower

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: My son is sick!

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: .-. And sitting outside his bedroom door all day’s gonna help? It’s that kind of babying has him...

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: “Babying?!”

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: .-. has him the way he is! That’s right. If you left him alone for a minute, Doris ...

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: «+. just gave him a break, then  36.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: He needs to know I’m here for him, Dave!!! SILENCE. Then, shoving past her:

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: I‘1l show you what he needs!

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Dave, please ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR BUCKLEY comes up the last few stairs and arrives at RICK’s door. He throws his shoulder against it.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Open the door, Rick!

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Dave!

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: (shoulders it again) Open the door, Rick!

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stop it, Dave!

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: (shoulders it again) I’m coming in, Rick! One more time and the door breaks inward, MR BUCKLEY’s momentum carrying him into the room toward RICK who stabs him through the arm with the KITCHEN KNIFE before retreating, dropping it, horrified at what he’s just done HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR BUCKLEY sits on the stairs, his arm being tended to by MEDIC. A POLICEMAN hovers.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN 1
dialogues.text: Do you want to press charges, Mr Buckley?

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Now, why the hell would I want to press charges ...?!

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: C.U RICK: sitting in the back. MR BUCKLEY (V.0O; CONT’D) ... He’s my bloody son!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESUME ARCHIE and MR BUCKLEY, who continues:

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: .-. I asked the doctor they had, how long they could keep him, and he said indefinitely?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: If someone is sectioned, then yes, I’m afraid they have the right to hold him until as long as they see fit.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Dave. INT. SKUNK’S BEDROOM - NIGHT SKUNK looks out her window at -

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: 49 50 51 as he makes his way back to his house. He gets to the fro door and goes in. SKUNK looks up to - RICK’S BEDROOM WINDOW It’s dark. Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK, JED, KASIA and MIKE sit around the table making paper airplanes of different colours and types from a pap airplane-making book. There are quite a few already made the table.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: But, what’s it like?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I don’t know, Skunk.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Is it like “One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest?”

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: “Mmm! Juicy Fruit!”

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You saw that?

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Me and Skunk one night Kasia fell asleep on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Was she drinking? (to KASIA) I’m joking.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: They cut a part of his brain out.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: “Mmm! Juicy Fruit!”

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Jed!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s not gonna happen to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: ‘Cos it’s not. That kind of thing isn’t done anymore. Now, come on, are we ready to see if these things fly or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paper airplane after paper airplane flies through the air Various shots of MIKE, SKUNK, JED, KASIA throwing more. SKUNK throws the occasional surreptitious admiring glance at MIKE. An idyllic feel is sustained throughout until, again, we -

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. SKUNK’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 53 She’s asleep. We hear muted shouting. She wakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As MIKE come out of the kitchen, followed by KASIA:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I’m fucking sick of it, too.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Of it all. The pushing ...

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck off!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: «+. the fucking obsessing! I am fucking off, and good fucking luck in the future finding someone willing to, to capitulate to your ...

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Someone who isn’t a child?  56 57 58 40.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s right. ... to your psychotic fucking demands, ‘cos it isn’t gonna be me. (grabbing his jacket; to himself) No way. (putting it on; to himself) No fucking way, Jose.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: So, that’s it ...?!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: .-. You’re gone?! Jesus, well, have a good fucking life ... asshole!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (opening the front door) You have a good life ...

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: «+. You crazy fucking bitch, you! He goes, slamming the door behind him. KASIA bursts into tears. She looks up to see SKUNK and JED on the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Have you and Mike split up?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to bed. She goes back into the kitchen. Slams the door. HOLD on SKUNK and JED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE and KASIA sit across from one another, a half- finished bottle of wine on the table. KASIA is crying.  4l.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: «+. Asshole. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, why the hell are you with a person unless you plan to stay with that person, you know?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Asshole! (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking Coward! And the things he said, you know what he called me, Archie?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: A crazy fucking bitch! BEAT. ARCHIE nods solemnly. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: (smiling) Sorry. KASIA smiles in spite of herself. Then, after a moment:

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Just so... (sighs) «+. worn out with it, Archie, you know?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Mm. They sit there in SILENCE. Then:

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You could sue him.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? For what?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I dunno. Dereliction of pre-marital duty?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Very funny. What about just for being a dick? A...  42.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, we could get him for that.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: «+. a lazy, a selfish dick, because that’s the problem, Archie. He values his freedom far too much, his comforts.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Most men do, Kasia.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: We need that push, you know?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: I’ve been pushing for four years, though, Archie. I’m sick of waiting for him. I’m thirty-six years old, you know? Thirty six and counting and I can’t wait any more ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: I can’t. I just can’t. She stares down at the table. ARCHIE watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DILLON stands at the front door, which opens ON THE CUT, revealing SKUNK.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Thought I’d knock around.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Jed’s out. DILLON nods. HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK and DILLON, who is carrying a packet of NIK-NAKS.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: I think she wanted him to get married ...

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: ... Or buy a house ... Or have a baby, maybe ... (PAUSE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would've married him.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Yeah? (seeing the scrapyard proper ) Oh, wow!

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Come over here. 43. As she leads him through the derelict cars, boats, etc.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Oh, wow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK and DILLON enter.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Oh, this is really cool. It’s like ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: .-. like a secret hideout or something. (sitting down in an armchair) You’re a really cool girl!

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: «+. For a lesbian. SKUNK rolls her eyebrows, sits in the other chair. opens his packet of NIK-NAKS.
DILLON (CONT’D) You wanna Nik-Nak?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Must be a pain, not being able to eat what you like. (she shrugs) You wanna be my girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (BEAT; then) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Can I give you a kiss? She looks at him. LONG PAUSE; then:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Maybe later.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Okay. Only later my mouth’s gonna be all Nik-Nakky.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. But not a splasher.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Not swirly tongues.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Okay. They both stand, kiss for a moment; then:

dialogues.speaker: DILLON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. They both sit back down. DILLON starts eating. They smile shyly at one another. INT. CUNNINGHAM KITCHEN —- NIGHT 61 ARCHIE sits in his suit at the kitchen table, again havin a late dinner. KASIA puts protective covers on schoolbook SKUNK and JED, in their pyjamas, wrestle on the floor. After a moment:  62 45.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: All right, guys. Bed. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: We're doing our books!

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Is that what you call it? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. I’ll do the rest of them.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Da-ad ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Do as you’re told. Come on. Big day tomorrow. SKUNK and JED get up, go to ARCHIE, kiss him goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Goodnight, dad.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: ‘Night, dad.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: ‘Night, guys. Then, as they go:

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Hey ... Where’s mine? They turn without stopping and both raise their middle finger, smiling:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK JED
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Katya. Goodnight, Katya.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Oh, very good. Very funny ... (calling after them) And don’t forget teeth! KASIA and ARCHIE continue their work a moment, then KASIA stops. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: You want a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK brushes her teeth. JED stands in the doorway.  63 64 46.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: .-. and if you wear shoes, they trip you up. And if you wear trainers, they stomp on ‘em - Bang! - And if your hair is long, what they do is grab it from behind ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: All right ... «+. and...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: «+. stop!

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: You need to know about this, Skunk. The better prepared you are, the better you’ll do. SKUNK looks at herself in the mirror. She is worried.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: So, they grab you by the hair ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE and KASIA sit at the table, drunk, a three-quarter empty bottle of gin between them. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: What about Rachel?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: What about her?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: If she walked in now, would you take her back?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: You're joking aren’t you?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Not even for the kids?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Why, so they could live in fear of her leaving again whenever the inclination took her? They wouldn’t even recognise her. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 66 47. ARCHIE (cont'd) (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you. She nods, looking into his eyes. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Poor Archie.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: (a smile) Poor Kasia. PAUSE. KASIA breaks eye-contact, finishes her glass of wine; then, getting up:

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: I’m gonna go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: All right. HOLD on ARCHIE, staring into space, as KASIA rinses her glass at the sink, etc. Then, standing over him:

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Goodnight. He looks up at her. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Goodnight. She leans down and kisses him passionately on the mouth, then whispers:

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Follow me up if you want. She goes. HOLD on ARCHIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE brushes his teeth, rinses, looks at himself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE tiptoes towards KASIA’s room. As he passes SKUNK’s door:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad ...? He freezes. Waits. After a moment:  67 48.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad ...! INT. SKUNK’S BEDROOM 67 ARCHIE steps into the doorway, stops.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Why aren’t you in bed? SKUNK is sitting on the floor, her back against the wall. She has her duvet pulled up to her chin.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Jed said I’m gonna get my head flushed down the toilet ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: By who?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: In school.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: And do you believe him?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: «+. And punched in the stomach. Yes, I believe him. He said it’s tradition, dad.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: He’s pulling your leg, love. Seriously. I was told the very same things when I was your age.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: That's the tradition.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Putting the fear of God into first-years. (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise you nothing’s going to happen, Skunk. (crosses his heart) See that?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (nods; PAUSE) Jed’s an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: (smiles; then) Come on. You getting into bed or what? As SKUNK goes to her bed, ARCHIE looks toward KASIA’s roo she is standing in the doorway in her underwear.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad ...?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: «+. Will you lie down beside me til I go asleep? BEAT. KASIA smiles regretfully, slowly closes her door. SKUNK (0.S; CONT’D) Dad ...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling SKUNK as she walks through the crowds, the scream the roughhousing, etc. She is very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids file in, SKUNK among them. She stops when she sees -

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: My God! Hi Mike! MIKE, sitting behind his desk, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It’s Mr Kiernan in school, Skunk ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Oh ...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: «+. Not Mike.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Well, in that case, you can call me Miss Cunningham. A smile between them. SKUNK takes her seat. MIKE stands u addresses the class:  50.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay, then ...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class is now filing out. As SKUNK passes:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Miss Cunningham ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr Kiernan?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: «+. How’s Kasia?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Kasia’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (nods; then) Say Hi from me, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK, JED and KASIA are eating their dinner.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: ... Do you have a message back?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class are filing in again. SKUNK stands with MIKE at his desk. He has a shocked look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Excuse me?!

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (giggles) That’s what she said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK, having just dressed after P.E, plays with her mobi phone while her friend, FIONA TORBY, fixes her hair at th mirror.  51.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: How many’d you get?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: A hundred.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: And a long one: “I must not use inappropriate language in ...”

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: Why can’t he just say “swear”?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: .-. in class. Exactly! SKUNK is suddenly shouldered hard. Her phone falls out of her hand and is picked up by SUNRISE OSWALD.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Why the hell’d you do that?!

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Shut up. Gimme some money.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Some money.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: ‘Cos I want some and ‘cos, if you don’t, my sister's gonna ... You know my sister, Saskia ...?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: «+. She’s gonna kick the fucking shit out of you. That’s why.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (considers this a moment; then) How much?

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: All you got. “How fucking much”!  75 76 SKUNK sighs, then she and FIONA both hand over which SUNRISE pockets. She exits.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, every week from next week on, I want two pounds from each of you.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK/FIONA
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: That's right. This is what it costs to stay off the list.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: What list?

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: “What list”?! (PAUSE; then) The list of fucking death, bitch. (then, handing phone back) Here’s your shit fucking loser’s out-of-date fucking mobile. SKUNK pushes buttons on her phone.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: It’s broken!

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: The cow ...! As their P.E teacher enters:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «+. The absolute fucking ugly, spiteful fucking ... SKUNK stops, seeing her. BEAT; then:

dialogues.speaker: P.E TEACHER
dialogues.text: Go on.
some coins 75 76 SKUNK sits at the kitchen table doing her lines. ARCHIE leans over her, looks down at what she’s writing. Then:  53.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: How many’d you get?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Two hundred.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Must’ve been one of the bad ones.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (turns to him) Can I get a mobile phone?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: You have one.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: It broke. Can I get a new one?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: ‘Cos you should've taken better care of the old one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE, KASIA and JED watch the news. SKUNK plays with ARCHIE’s hair, speaks like an Enid Blyton character.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: It’d make me so happy ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Sshh!

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: «+. I’d just be the happiest child ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I’m trying to ... (pulling his head away) Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK knocks on the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE sits on the toilet, reading the paper.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Go away, Skunk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE eats his dinner. SKUNK lies on the couch. Sullen:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: It’s just not fair.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I don’t care.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: About me.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: You don’t care about me.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Give me a break, Skunk, will you?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you don’t. (LONG PAUSE; then, under her breath) You wish I was dead.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE is putting his coat on to go to work. SKUNK is shadowing him.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Pleeeease, dad?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Stop now.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Pleeeeease?  81 55.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: SKUNK is shocked into silence. PAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, I don’t want to hear it again! Do you understand?! (PAUSE; louder) Do you understand! She nods, lip aquiver. He leaves the house. The door closes. PAUSE. Then, from the KITCHEN:

dialogues.speaker: JED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (doing NELSON from The Simpsons ) Haw-Haw!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DILLON and SKUNK sit in the front of an old truck. SKUNK eating M&Ms. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Ten past ten. Do you think he’s learned his lesson yet?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Who’s this? SUSAN OSWALD runs through the SCRAPYARD, pursued by an OLDER BOY, who catches her around the waist, swings her around, puts her down.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Slut.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: What? No, she’s not. DILLON shrugs. SKUNK continues to eat her M&M’s. SUSAN unzips the OLDER BOY and begins giving him a blowjo

dialogues.speaker: DILLON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Told you ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: frozen, an M&M halfway to her open mouth. DILLON (0.S; CONT’D) ++. You call it fellatio.  82 83 84 85 56. She now looks down at the M&M she’s holding. DILLON (0.S; CONT’D) Skunk ...?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: I have to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens and SKUNK enters, closing it quietly behind her.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK enters, almost bumping into KASIA.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Where were you? (SKUNK shrugs) Why didn’t you call?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: I don’t have a phone. KASIA suddenly grabs her by the arm and slaps her arse several times - hard.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: How dare you ...!! How dare you do what you just did, you little brat!! SKUNK is in tears. KASIA dials her mobile, waits, then:

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Yeah, she’s here. She’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE sits in an armchair, staring at the TV. SKUNK stan contritely in front of him. After several moments:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, dad. SILENCE. ARCHIE gets up, leaves the room. HOLD on SKUNK. INT. SKUNK’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 85

dialogues.speaker: HER FINGER
dialogues.text: 86 87 57. is pressed down on the TEST STRIP, leaving blood-deposit.

dialogues.speaker: THE TEST STRIP
dialogues.text: is put into the meter on the MACHINE which gives the numerical reading.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: looks at it. Frowns. HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE sits reading the newspaper. SKUNK enters. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: My levels are off. INT. SKUNK’S BEDROOM 87 SKUNK is now in her pyjamas. She sits on the edge of the bed. ARCHIE prepares an insulin injection.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: You can never forget how important this is ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: ... Routine. I know it’s hard, but ....

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Say, “It’s okay,” dad.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: I said I was sorry, now you have to say, “It’s okay.’

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s okay. BEAT. He hugs her tightly. Then:

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know how much I worry about you ...?  58.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: «».. you and Jed, and how much I love you?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I don’t think I would ever stop, love. After a LONG PAUSE:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Tell me about the night I was born.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Oh, come on ...! The night?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: The dream.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Again?! I don’t even understand why you like it, Skunk.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: (shakes his head; then) All right. It was about this woman ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: .»-. and it was different times in her life.  59.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Different moments.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: And the woman was me.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: The woman was you.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: And the dream was my future.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t know, but that’s what it felt like, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: And what did I look like?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Stunning.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: And then you woke.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I woke and I was crying and laughing all at once.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: And mum was there.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: She said, “Archie ... (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Meaning me.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Well, you were the one about to be born ... (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «-. weren’t you. She’s crying.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: oh, Skunk!

dialogues.text: (laughing) I can’t help it!

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: You’re a very strange girl, love. Come on. Lets get this done. She pulls her top up, exposing her stomach. ARCHIE inject her.

dialogues.text: (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have your swollen fucking head kicked in. Chubby cunt. She goes. HOLD on SKUNK and FIONA.

dialogues.text: Oh, wow, you’ve got your own telly and all.

dialogues.text: Yeah. You know, I watch, um... (struggles to remember; SILENCE; then) I’m sorry.

dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.text: When you went kinda mad. (to MR BUCKLEY) Is it all right to say that?  94 64.

dialogues.speaker: RICK

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: ++. Or a mist of ... I don’t know, evil or something ...

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: «+. Or badness. Yeah.

dialogues.text: Less. Less. MR BUCKLEY (CONT’D) In fact, Doctor Sinclair says, at this rate of improvement, Rick might be able to come home for a weekend. Right, son?

dialogues.text: .».. yeah, I’d an uncle was crazy something like that, he thought he'd worms in his hair ...

dialogues.text: Sir!

dialogues.text: You ruined it! KIM punches STEPHEN again.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: «+. Why did you have to ruin it?! HOLD on SKUNK as the chaos continues.  69.

dialogues.text: .-. I don’t know, it was like ...

dialogues.text: «+. like he just switched off or something. Click ...!

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: «+. I... Sunrise ...!

dialogues.text: Dumpy little turd. She goes. SKUNK watches, then notices that several kids scattered around the playground are just standing there solemnly, staring right at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK on her way home. She stops, seeing ahead of her, SUNRISE and her big sister, SASKIA. INT. MIKE’S CAR 100 MIKE drives home. He takes a corner, sees, as they pass, running in the opposite direction, SKUNK and her pursuers

dialogues.text: Please ... (as they get closer) Please ... SUNRISE punches her in the face. She falls, curls up into ball as the two girls begin kicking her.  71.

dialogues.text: Fucking fat fucking bitch ...! Frigid fucking slut ...! Hey! They are being pulled away from her by MIKE.

dialogues.text: Fucking touch me again, I'1l report you ...!

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: «+. Fucking queer! (to SUNRISE) Come on.

dialogues.text: (as SUNRISE obeys) Whatcha doing? Don’t listen to him.

dialogues.text: Skunk ...? (BEAT)

dialogues.text: “Darling”?!  102 103 104 72. SKUNK looks up at MIKE. Her nose is bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE

dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: +s. OF away ...

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: «+. to get perspective.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Mike. (BEAT)

dialogues.text: What the fuck?! The guy turns around. It’s JED. SKUNK, in shock, backs aw

dialogues.text: «+. What could I do ...?
