dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: That I was with you. What else?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: And where was Skunk at the time?  77.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Upstairs. But we need to tell her, Archie ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: .-. her and Jed.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I know. Just let me, uh ... We hear the front door opening. After a moment, SKUNK enters. ARCHIE goes to her.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Let me see. (squats down, examines her face) Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Sit down and tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (as they sit) There’s nothing to tell, dad.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Of course there is. Who was it?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: I dunno. Some girl.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: And why did she ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Can we talk about it another time, dad?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Skunk... PAUSE. We hear the front door open and close, then footsteps running up the stairs and another door closing. PAUSE. Everyone looks at each other. 111 INT. JED’S BEDROOM 111 He is lying in bed, miserable. SKUNK enters.  78.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: You have to come down for your dinner. (LONG PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: You know what.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: I dunno.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Why her?

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: I dunno! Promise you won’t tell anyone, will you?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Okay. I just don’t ...

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: You haven’t promised!

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: I promise. I just don’t understand why people would do that.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: It’s what you do when you’re in love.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: You're in love?!

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: I am. I don’t know about her.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: And what if she’s pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: She’s not! Jesus ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: What if, though?

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Skunk! SKUNK stops. LONG PAUSE; then:  79.

dialogues.speaker: JED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's for dinner? 112 INT. SUSAN’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 112 SUSAN sits with SUNRISE.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you don’t know?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I’m not sure.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, whose could it be, then?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Simon Malloy’s ...

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Okay ...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: «+. Jed Cunningham's, Dennis Woods’ ...

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Jed Cunningham's?!

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Who else?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: A couple of guys whose names I can’t remember ... Who’s the one with the dreadlocks?

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Nicky Cantwell?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: He’s going to fucking kill me, Sunrise!

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: He’s not. Just let me ...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Yes, he is!

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: .-. Just let me think for a minute, will you?  113 80. HOLD as she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB has the TV in his arms again. He struggles under the weight. SUSAN, SUNRISE (both wearing school uniforms) and SASKIA watch in horror.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: .-- Dad, don’t ...!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I will and it won’t even matter, ‘cos after, I'll lock you all in the fucking shed and I won't let you fucking out, you hear me?! Drastic fucking measures’re gonna be taken unless you give me the dirty bastard father’s fucking name! (BEAT; raises the TV)

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Mister Kiernan!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (BEAT; then, lowering the TV) Who the fuck is ...?

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: He’s a teacher in school.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: He ... He took me for lifts in his car ...! The TV slips out of BOB’s grip, crashing to the floor. Da-ad!!!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULLING BOB in C.U down the empty corridor. SUSAN (V.O; CONT’D) «+. He said I could be his girlfriend if I ... if I let him put it in me! FOLLOWING BOB into - INT. MIKE’S CLASSROOM 115 The class is going wild, kids screaming at each other, throwing things, etc. MIKE sits behind his desk, obliviou to it all, staring off into space, then - BANG! BOB knocks him off his chair and begins beating him viciously. MIKE curls up into a ball as blows rain down. After several moments of this, BOB screams. SKUNK has her arms around him and is biting into his wais He grabs her by the hair and pulls her away from him. The raising his fist to hit her:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Mr Oswald ...! He hesitates. SKUNK is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... It’s a lovely day, look? SILENCE. BOB looks out the window. It’s raining. He looks at the class, all the frightened faces staring at him. He looks at SKUNK again. Another PAUSE, then:

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: It’s fucking raining! He releases her, goes.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Mike! She runs to him, squats down. He has blood all over his face. His nose is broken. His eyes are beginning to swell One of his front teeth is missing.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Mike! MRS MCCLUSKEY enters, followed by MR BROWN, the school janitor. Seeing MIKE:  82.

dialogues.speaker: MRS MCCLUSKEY
dialogues.text: My God! Mr Brown, call an ambulance! Call the police!

dialogues.speaker: MR BROWN
dialogues.text: (exiting) Will do!

dialogues.speaker: MRS MCCLUSKEY
dialogues.text: My God! 116 INT. OSWALD’S HOUSE - DAY 116 Present are BOB, SASKIA and SUSAN. SUNRISE comes running in. (SUSAN and SUNRISE still wear school uniforms)

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: They're coming, dad!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: All right. (kneeling down in front of SUSAN) Now, you know I’1l be back, and you know I’1ll make sure every- thing turns out okay, don’t you? (she nods; he embraces her) I love you so fucking much. Loud knocking. A VOICE in the letterbox.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Mr Oswald?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I love you all so much.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Mr Oswald!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (to the other girls) Cc’mere, we'll do a big fucking family hug. They gather around him so that he can embrace them all. HOLD, then - 117 EXT. OSWALD’S HOUSE - DAY 117 Four POLICEMEN manhandle a struggling BOB out the door.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (calling back) Saskia! No boys, all right? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB (cont'd) No parties! (to POLICEMEN) Fucking pigs!

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN 1
dialogues.text: No need for that, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Cunts!

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN 1
dialogues.text: No need for that kind of abuse, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (calling back) «+. And stay away from my fucking shit! They continue to struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE, bruises, stitches, etc., is being interrogated by D CARSON (male) and DC JENKS (female).

dialogues.speaker: DC CARSON
dialogues.text: «+. and, when’s the last time you saw Miss Oswald.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Last week.

dialogues.speaker: DC CARSON
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Outside the school. She was hurting another child, so I had to ... Hang on, did you say Sunrise?

dialogues.speaker: DC CARSON
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sunrise Oswald?

dialogues.speaker: DC CARSON
dialogues.text: Susan. (to DC JENKS) What did we say?  84.

dialogues.speaker: DC JENKS
dialogues.text: Susan.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Right. No, no, it was Sunrise I reprimanded. Susan, I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: DC CARSON
dialogues.text: You don’t know her.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No. Well, I know her, she’s in the school, but I’ve never had any contact with her.

dialogues.speaker: DC CARSON
dialogues.text: I see. Well, she claims you’ve been having an affair.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: She what?!

dialogues.speaker: DC CARSON
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s insane. How old is she? DC JENKS addresses MIKE for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: DC JENKS
dialogues.text: She’s fourteen years old, Mr Kiernan. She’s also pregnant. LONG PAUSE. MIKE just stares at her; then:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I have the right to call a solicitor, don’t I?

dialogues.speaker: DC JENKS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well, I’d like to do that now. The door opens and a POLICEWOMAN pops her head in.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEWOMAN
dialogues.text: Sorry, uh ... Mr Kiernan’ solicitor’s here. DC JENKS and DC CARSON look at each other.  85.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: .-. And this is alleged only.

dialogues.speaker: DC CARSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: So, you haven’t arrested him yet.

dialogues.speaker: DC CARSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: For the moment, he’s helping us with our inquiries.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: (to MIKE) Get your jacket on. GO WIDE to include MIKE, DC JENKS, DC CARSON, as:

dialogues.speaker: DC JENKS
dialogues.text: Wait a minute ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: She’s a liar.

dialogues.speaker: DC JENKS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: She’s done this kind of thing before, Detective. Check it out. Another man, another accusation -— essentially of rape - another lie. Now, make a decision; release my client or, better yet, arrest him so we can take this matter further when her story falls apart. (SILENCE; then, to MIKE) Get your coat.

dialogues.speaker: DC CARSON
dialogues.text: Hang on ... (BEAT; then, heading for the door) «+. I just need a word with my superior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE and MIKE at the bar, drinks in front of them.  86.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Thank Kasia, Mike. She’s the one who convinced me to ...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: «+. to come in for you.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: How are you two doing?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I don’t really want to talk about that.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Do you not?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Why? Is what you have so special it can’t be articulated?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It’s because it’s none of your business, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Fuck you, you know what? The last thing I need, beyond losing the fucking woman I love, is to be obliged to the man who stole her.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I didn’t steal her ...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: .+. And there’s no obligation.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck off, Archie, will you? You couldn't be more patronising if you tried. ARCHIE watches MIKE simmer a moment; then:  87.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Fair enough. (getting up) Look after yourself, Mike. ARCHIE goes. HOLD on MIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE, KASIA, SKUNK and JED have dinner.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: «+. Then what?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I dunno. They might do a DNA test ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Do you know what that is?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: It’s a test that’1ll show he isn’t the father.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: He isn’t the father ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: We know.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: ... She’s a liar. I mean, everyone knows she’s done it with ... (unconsciously glancing at JED) ++. God, with lots of boys ...

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter, Skunk.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Because they’re boys. Mike is an adult, you understand? A teacher. And in this kind of situation, they have to be absolutely sure of his innocence. And until they are, they just can’t allow him to work with children. The doorbell rings. JED goes to answer the door.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: So, he’s not coming back.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Not for the moment, no. (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Darling. SILENCE. JED returns. As he sits back down:

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: For you, Skunk.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT DOOR 123
dialogues.text: is opened by SKUNK to reveal DILLON standing there.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Hi. Do you wanna go for a walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK and DILLON stand there.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Birmingham? !

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: But I thought ... I thought you and me were gonna go to Florida, and see ...

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: That was ... Yeah, but ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: «+. you know, see the lizards and all.  89.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: ... That was when we’re older.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Why not now, though?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: ‘Cos my aunt says I have to go to Birmingham, Skunk.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what am I gonna do without you?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Here ... He takes a friendship bracelet out of his pocket. DILLON (CONT’D) «+. Will you take this?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: To remember me by. She takes it. PAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: When do you go?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Tomorrow? !

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Early. So I’m not gonna get to see you again. SKUNK is in shock. PAUSE; then:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: And how long did you know this?

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: What? She starts hitting him.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: How long did you know this, you’re only telling me now?! You’re an arsehole, Dillon ...  90.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: (fending her off) Skunk!

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: «+. How long did you know you were going?!

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Skunk! Stop! She stops hitting him. They just stand there. DILLON (CONT’D) I wanted to tell you, but I was afraid to. (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don’t hate me, Skunk.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: You’re leaving me, Dillon.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: Yeah, but ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Of course I hate you! BEAT; then, shouting -

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘1l always hate you! She runs away. HOLD on DILLON.

dialogues.speaker: AN ODDLY SHAPED CAKE 125
dialogues.text: upon which is inscribed with icing: “Welcome home, Rick!

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s not.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: “Fine”! ... MR and MRS BUCKLEY stand in their KITCHEN, looking down a the cake.  91. MRS BUCKLEY (CONT’D) .-. I wanted it to be perfect.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Is it edible?

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Course it is! How dare you?!

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: And the sentiment’s legible. I mean, that’s all you want, really, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: I’ve gotta go. (kisses her) He'll love it, Doris. He goes. She calls after him: MRS BUCKLEY (CONT’D) Oh, get some milk on your way back, Dave, would you?

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sure. We hear the front door open and close. HOLD. 126 INT. OSWALD’S HOUSE - EVENING 126 SASKIA, SUNRISE, SUSAN and several others, male and femal party. The place is a mess, everyone drinking, smoking BOB’s weed. SASKIA makes out with a BEARDED GUY. SUSAN watches EASTENDERS on the much smaller TV we saw earlier the kitchen. The doorbell rings. Nobody moves.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Is anyone gonna get that? (no answer; another ring) Saskia ...? (no answer; then, getting up) Fucking hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opened by SUSAN to reveal JED standing there.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Hi Jed.  128 92.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you about something?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: (sways slightly; BEAT; then) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say that, if you want me to, then I’1l be the daddy.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: The what?!

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: The dad of the baby. I’11 take, you know, the responsibility for it. You and me can get married and ...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Jed, listen: we’re having a party here, all right?

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: But ...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Don’t call over again. She shuts the door in his face. As she heads back down th hall, we can see that the backs of her tracksuit bottoms are dark with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody’s mellower now except SASKIA and SUNRISE who ar dancing to their dance instruction DVD on the couch. Between them, SUSAN lies asleep. She is right at the sofa edge and, inevitably, after a bit more dancing, she toppl onto the floor -

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Whoops! and stays there, unmoving. PAUSE; then:  129 93.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Susan?

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: Oh, God! Sunrise!

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: Oh, God! Oh, Jesus ...!

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Shit. She has just seen what SASKIA is shouting about. The sofa where SUSAN has just been lying, is covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: «+. Oh, God!

dialogues.speaker: BEARDED GUY
dialogues.text: What’s going on? SUNRISE is now in front of SUSAN, shaking her.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Susan! (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan! Call an ambulance, Saskia.

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: What’s the number?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Nine-nine-nine, you twat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. Rick’s DOCTOR signs a couple of forms at the counter. He gives them to the RECEPTIONIST, then, turning to MR BUCKLEY and RICK:

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: So, you have my number, so don’t forget: routine, medication ... I gave you the chart ...

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: ..-. and calm. So, lets, in as much as we can, confine things to the home for the weekend, okay? Just to be safe this first time out.  94. A strange looking PATIENT wanders past in the background, staring intensely at them. Then, to DOCTOR:

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Yes. Of course. Thank you, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Not at all. Best of luck, Rick. (shaking his hand) Have a great weekend.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 130
dialogues.text: MR BUCKLEY drives, RICK beside him. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: I wonder does he mean we can’t have a kickabout. I wouldn’t mind a bit of a kickabout. Rick?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Would you?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: I think I'd rather stay inside, dad.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Fair enough. No, you’re probably right. Best to go by the book. (PAUSE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mum made a cake.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Mm-hm.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: It's lopsided. (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just thought I should warn you. RICK smiles a little. They turn into DRUMMOND CLOSE and a lit through the windscreen by flashing blue lights -

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Something going on there, eh, Rick? which belong to an ambulance parked outside the Oswalds. SUSAN is being taken out on a stretcher. Her sisters stan about, upset.  95.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Nothing changes, right? MR BUCKLEY pulls the car up outside his own house. MR BUCKLEY (CONT’D; O.S) .-. Well, we won’t let it bother us will we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they get out of the car, MRS BUCKLEY comes running out of the house and throws her arms around RICK (Over the following, RICK never takes his eyes off what’s happening outside the Oswalds’).

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, my darling! My darling, welcome home!

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Guess what? I forgot to get the milk.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, Dave!

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: I’1l just nip down to the garage, shall I?

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: (of the Oswalds) What’s going on up there?

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: (getting back into the car) Pay no attention. I'll be back in five minutes. He drives away. MRS BUCKLEY turns back to RICK, who is still staring; taking his arm:

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Come on, Rick. You heard your father. Pay no attention. SASKIA spots him.

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Here’s the other pervert, look? SUNRISE looks. SASKIA shouts at RICK:

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: It’s because of fucking scum like you that this is happening!  131 132 96.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Fucking rapist!

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: Fucking sicko! MRS BUCKLEY gently urges:

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Come on, darling. Lets go inside. As she guides him toward the door:

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fucking evil bastard!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS BUCKLEY shuts the door, then turns to see RICK headin up the stairs. She frowns.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Rick? Where are you going? He stops. Then, without turning:

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: To my room.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: But ...

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Just for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: But, I made you cake, love.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (BEAT; then ascending again) I’1l have some later, mum.

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: (hurrying after him) But, you only just got here, Rick. Please! Don’t go to your room .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUND of the AMBULANCE SIREN passing outside, takes us to

dialogues.speaker: 132B
dialogues.text: where MRS BUCKLEY catches up and grabs RICK’s arm. Becomi hysterical now: MRS BUCKLEY (CONT’D) ... Please, love! Don’t mind what they said.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: But, they’re right, mum!

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: No ...

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: They're right!

dialogues.speaker: MRS BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: ... they’re not! They couldn’t be more wrong! You’re gentle, and good and ... Please come down, Rick ... Please ... He moves away. She grabs him again, panicking: MRS BUCKLEY (CONT’D) ... Please, love. Don’t go to your room ... (they struggle) .-.- Please, love ... Please, love .-. Please, love ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 133 The ambulance speeds past camera, its SIREN blasting loud INT. CONVENIENCE STORE. Quiet. MR BUCKLEY buys milk and toilet roll.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: INT. CAR — MOVING MR BUCKLEY drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 134 135 136 137 MRS BUCKLEY lies at the bottom of the stairs, eyes starin body contorted into an impossible position.  98. We hear Mr Buckley’s CAR pulling in, the ENGINE turning off, the DOOR opening and closing. SILENCE. THE FRONT DOOR opens and MR BUCKLEY enters -—

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Guys ...? closing it behind him. He turns, sees MRS BUCKLEY. SILENC then:

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Doris ...? (getting down on one knee) Doris! Jesus Christ! (trying to hold her) Jesus Christ! (calling)

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, dad. RICK is standing in the hallway. He is crying.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: What did you do?! (to MRS BUCKLEY) Doris! He gets to his feet, takes out his mobile. MR BUCKLEY (CONT’D) I’ve gotta call somebody.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Please!

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: (dialling) I've gotta call somebody, Rick!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: They’1l say I’m bad.  138 99.

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: (putting his phone to his ear) What?!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: They'll say I’m bad like before, but it wasn’t me ...

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Rick ...

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: ... It wasn’t my fault! MR BUCKLEY, waiting for his call to be answered, ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please, dad ...

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Rick ...

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ++. You don’t have to tell them!

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: Rick ... (into phone) Hello? RICK rushes forward -

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: YOU DON’T HAVE TO TELL THEM, DAD! then, stabbing him repeatedly with the kitchen knife:

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: YOU DON’T HAVE TO TELL THEM, DAD! YOU DON’T HAVE TO TELL THEM ...! INT. SKUNK’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 138 ARCHIE knocks on the open door -

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Skunk ...? and enters. SKUNK sits, as before, on the floor, back against the wal duvet pulled up to her chin.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «.. You okay?  100.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me and Jed about you and Kasia?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to find the, um... I suppose, the right moment ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Are you gonna marry her?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (calling) I know you’re out there! KASIA appears in the doorway. SKUNK continues to ARCHIE:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you? (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she’1ll leave us, dad, the way she left Mike, like mum left us, like everyone does.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: You will. Don’t lie. It’ll all go wrong as usual, dad. Everything always goes wrong. Why do only bad things ever happen?!

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Good things happen too.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Like what, your love affair? What about me? Or Jed? Or Rick? Or Mike? What about Mike, Kasia?!!

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Skunk. I ...

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Get out! I don’t wanna talk to either of you. (PAUSE; a shout)

dialogues.speaker: A CELL DOOR 139
dialogues.text: being opened by an OFFICER. With him is POLICEMAN 1.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN 1
dialogues.text: Mr Oswald ...?

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN 1
dialogues.text: ++. I’m afraid I have some unfortunate news.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 142
dialogues.text: INT. SKUNK’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 143 SKUNK walks to her window, reaches to close her curtains, when she sees —

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: standing at his own window.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: is astonished. After a moment, she raises her hand, waves tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: raises his own hand. But, instead of waving, he beckons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following SKUNK in a SINGLE SHOT as she makes her way across the green, all the way to the BUCKLEY’s house. She arrives at the door, knocks, waits. The door opens. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Hi Rick.  145 146

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB is screaming, out of control with grief. Doctors and security restrain him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE, KASIA and JED. ARCHIE paces, phone in hand.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I’1l kill her.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Maybe ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Maybe what?! She knows she has to call if she’s gonna be late ...

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Call her again.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: (dialling again) .-. She knows from last time. He puts the phone to his ear and waits; then:

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Skunk? I’m really worried. Please call me, will you, darling? It’s dad. (clicking off) Oh, fuck this. He grabs his coat from the back of a chair.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: To look for her. As he puts it on:

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: I know where she might be, dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE enters, JED behind him. ARCHIE shines a torch around.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: .-. And, what? You come here to ...

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Just to hang out.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. (shines the torch around some more; then) Whose are the cigarettes? The beam is on the ashtray, full of butts.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Not mine. ARCHIE shines the torch in JED’s guilty face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step out. ARCHIE looks around, takes out his phone, checks it, puts it back in his pocket. PAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Come on, Skunk. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK 153
dialogues.text: in profile. She is lying on her back on the floor of RICK BEDROOM. She is terrified. RICK’s face enters frame, his mouth moving to SKUNK’s. Then, their lips not quite touching, he inhales as if taking her breath from her bod SILENCE. He does it again. SILENCE.  154

dialogues.speaker: 154B
dialogues.text: And again. SILENCE. And again. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE argues with a POLICEMAN.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: «+. I’m just saying, kids, they wander in; they’ve been to a party ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Christ ...!

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: --. a friend’s ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: «+. We’ve spoken to all her friends, okay? We’ve exhausted that possibility along with every other! Now my daughter has type 1 diabetes, and if she doesn’t stay monitored, she ...

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Calm down ... All right ...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: «+. she could die, do you understand me?! She could die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JED starts crying. As ARCHIE sees this:

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Shit. C’mere, son. JED goes to ARCHIE. ARCHIE embraces him. HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KASIA stands at the back door, smoking, fretting. Her pho rings from the LIVING ROOM. She rushes in, picks it up, answers.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Archie?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Kasia?  105.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Mike?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sorry to ring so late ... 154¢ INT. MIKE’S FLAT 154C MIKE, very drunk, sits on his couch.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .»-. Can I talk to you? We CUT BACK AND FORTH between them until stated.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Mike. This isn’t really ...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna keep you long, all right? I just wanted to ring this once to say, I dunno, sorry ...?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: .».. to say thank you?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I dunno. For helping me out today, I suppose? Archie as well, of course, I was fairly rude to him earlier on and I didn’t mean to be, he’s a decent guy, and I just wanna say you're a very good match and I wish you the best ... (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. I wish you the very best.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Will you do me a favour, Kasia? Will you apologise to Skunk for me ...?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Just for all the stupid embarrassing shit she’s had to be witness to. She’s a terrific kid, you know? Jed as well, of course, but Skunk, I dunno, some day she’s gonna blow us all away, d’you reckon, Kasia? KASIA puts her hand over her mouth to prevent herself fro crying.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: D’you reckon she’s gonna blow us all away?

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: Mm-hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK sits against the wall, staring in horror at SKUNK, w lies on the floor, her breaths coming in shallow gasps, h body spasming violently, foam spilling from her mouth, he eyes rolling back in her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KASIA is barely holding herself together.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway. That’s all I wanted to say. Thank you, Kasia. INT. MIKE’S FLAT 155C MIKE continues:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have a good life, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KASIA nods.

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: You too, Mike.  156

dialogues.speaker: 156B
dialogues.text: 157 158 159 160 161 107. Click. He’s gone. HOLD on KASIA. After a moment, the soun of a car turning into the close makes her look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE’S CAR comes to a stop outside. He and JED get out. ARCHIE looks up, his eye caught by the light in RICK’S WINDOW. He stares at it a second before:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Well? He turns. KASIA is standing at their door. JED is already walking toward her. He passes inside without saying anything. ARCHIE and KASIA just stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN 156B
dialogues.text: The sun is coming up.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 157
dialogues.text: INT. OSWALD’S HOUSE - BEDROOM - DAWN 158 SASKIA and SUNRISE lie together in the same bed. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Did dad come home?

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB, devastated, sits in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi pulls up outside the OSWALDS’ HOUSE. BOB gets ou The taxi drives away. BOB stands there, looking at his front door, trying to find the courage to enter.

dialogues.speaker: OVER HIS SHOULDER
dialogues.text: and just out of focus, a FIGURE staggers out of the BUCKL HOUSE. BOB turns, sees —

dialogues.speaker: MR BUCKLEY
dialogues.text: covered in blood. He sways a little, then collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS BUCKLEY'S dead body lies at the bottom of the stairs. BOB is standing over it.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Jesus ... Christ ...! He looks up. A fast, continuous thumping noise is coming from upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Rick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling BOB up the last couple of stairs, across the landing, the thumping sound increasing in volume, and int

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where the first thing he sees is RICK sitting against the wall, head slumped forward, dead, blood from his slit throat everywhere. BOB reacts, then looks around to see -

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: lying on the floor, vomit on her front, her body contorti in a diabetic fit. As he moves to her:

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Oh, no... no... no... Darling, no ... He gets down, cradles her in his arms, looks wildly aroun sees her PHONE on the bed, grabs it, dials, waits; then:  166 167 168 169 109.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Hello? Can I get an ambulance, please? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s fif ... It’s fourteen Drummond Close. That’s in... Yes. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fit. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t know. There’s someone’s been stabbed as well. And ... (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fucking know, could you just fucking come, please? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. He looks at SKUNK. Her fit has subsided a little. He look at the phone in his hand. INT. SKUNK’S BEDROOM 166 ARCHIE lies curled up and asleep on SKUNK’s bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB scrolls through SKUNK’s address book. CLOSE ON SCREEN: as it stops on - DAD. INT. SKUNK’S BEDROOM 168 ARCHIE’s phone rings. He wakes, reaches into his pocket, fumbles it out. CLOSE ON SCREEN: It reads -— SKUNK. ARCHIE stares. HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK is unconscious now, completely unmoving. BOB holds her tightly, his face against hers, continues to rock her

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: «+. There we are now ... There we are ... Daddy’s coming, Darling  110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling ARCHIE as he hurries toward the Buckleys. BOB (V.0O; CONT’D) «+. Daddy’s on his way ... Daddy’s on his way ... (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. Daddy’s on his way ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE sits in a chair beside a hospital bed, holding SKUNK’s hand in both of his. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I won't deny it’s getting tough to think of things to talk about, Skunk. I mean, not enough happens in a day to fill, you know, ten minutes lately. Although the scan is pretty impressive, isn’t it? A BABY SCAN photo lying on SKUNK’s bed.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: That’s pretty exciting. BACK TO ARCHIE.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you know, Kasia... Not that boys are better than girls, but Kasia kept saying, “No, let it be a suprise,” - the gender, like - but then, when the woman asked, she’s ... you know, if we wanted to know what it was, she’s like, “Oh, we'd absolutely love to, yes!" (shakes his head) I dunno. Couldn’t help herself, I suppose. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell am I going to cope, love? Christ! ‘Nother boy in the house ... (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Another Jed! (PAUSE) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The thing that annoys me, though, is she gets pissed off all the time - Kasia- tells me I need to spend more time at home. Bit naggy, actually. (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though I won’t deny that, what, with work and with coming here to see you, I suppose my attention has been lacking a little bit lately ... (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- But ... (breaking down a little) «+. you're my girl, Skunk ... (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. You're my girl, so, how can I do anything else, you know ...?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: her eyes closed. Unmoving.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: «+. How can I ever do anything else? HOLD for several moments; then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of THE ROOM, ARCHIE, SKUNK. HOLD for several moments; the

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: his head bowed, SKUNK’s hand still held in his. Oddly, th background is now different, suggestive more of a church than a hospital room. HOLD again; then -

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: again. Her background has also changed. An entire church spread out behind her. HOLD; then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the back of the church. SKUNK, alone now, is standing, facing us. HOLD; then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: just staring straight ahead. SILENCE; then -

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Skunk! She turns to see:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Jed!

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: Hey, sis. Looking good.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: JED
dialogues.text: No, I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Kasia!

dialogues.speaker: KASIA
dialogues.text: (appearing; hugging her) Oh, I’m so proud of you, darling. SKUNK steps back, looking down at KASIA’s swollen stomach KASIA(CONT’D) Your new brother.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Wow! (then, seeing MIKE) Oh, my God! He also hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m good. SKUNK looks around the church. Gathered are all the peopl she’s known in her life. Among them she spots -

dialogues.speaker: THE BARLOW BROTHERS
dialogues.text: who glide past on their scooters. Her gaze follows them t  113.

dialogues.speaker: DILLON
dialogues.text: standing with several other YOUNG MEN. He raises his wris points at it. She looks at her own, seeing the friendship bracelet he gave to her. Next up is -

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Fiona! They hug.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: I’m so happy for you, Skunk. They come apart as -

dialogues.speaker: THE OSWALDS
dialogues.text: burst loudly through the front doors. As they walk along the back wall, a MAN accidentally collides with BOB.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You got a problem? SASKIA grabs his arm, hisses -

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: Dad! For fuck’s sake! and pulls him into the back row where SUSAN and SUNRISE a already seated. He looks up, then smiles sheepishly at -

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: who smiles sheepishly back. Then:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Skunk? She turns.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Rick! They hug. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: For what?  114.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: For all the pain you had in your life.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Don’t be. They come apart; BEAT; then:

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (PAUSE; then) Why isn’t my dad here?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: He doesn’t want to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: That’s silly. (SILENCE; then) What's it like there?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Really? Will I be happy?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Very.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Will I be able to eat what I like? (off his smile) What?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Nothing. Yes. You’ll be able to eat what you like.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Even M&Ms?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: (after a LONG PAUSE) I can’t go without saying goodbye to my dad.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: All right.  115.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Can I do that?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Of course you can. He’s outside. SKUNK turns and looks at the church’s INNER DOORS. Then,

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: All right. Be back in a minute. She walks down the aisle toward the doors, pulls one open and steps into -

dialogues.speaker: THE FOYER
dialogues.text: on the far side of which ARCHIE stands beside the half-op OUTSIDE DOOR. Through it, we can see a beautiful GARDEN filled with sunlight. After a SILENCE:

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Why won’t you say goodbye?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Why won’t you come back?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: It’s just too hard, Dad. (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hate me?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Why would I hate you?

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: For going.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I love you, Skunk. I’1l always love you.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Then I need you to say it.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: You can. Of course you can. (LONG PAUSE; then, crying) Just say Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Why should I?  172 173 174 116.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: Because I’m your girl. ARCHIE also starts crying. PAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say Goodbye, dad. LONG PAUSE; finally, through his tears:

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Goodbye, love. She is already running toward him. He moves forward too a she leaps into his arms in the middle of the FOYER and he spins her around, holding her as tightly as he can.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: her eyes shut tight, as we -

dialogues.speaker: FLASH ON
dialogues.text: a series of vaguely formed images.

dialogues.speaker: A WOMAN
dialogues.text: throws her arms around a smiling man. Cuts her finger while chopping carrots. Stands at the top of a mountain, looking down at the landscape below. Holds the hand of another woman who is crying. Pushes a child on a bicycle.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE 173
dialogues.text: holding SKUNK to him.

dialogues.speaker: THE WOMAN 174
dialogues.text: runs full out on an athletics track. Is examined by a doctor. Holds her hands out as a smiling toddler toddles into the Prunes roses.  175 176 177 178 117. Waltzes with a man at a party. Stumbles. Recovers. Laughs Wades in the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: SKUNK
dialogues.text: eyes closed, still in her father’s embrace.

dialogues.speaker: THE WOMAN 176
dialogues.text: sets candles into a child’s birthday cake. Sinks under the water of a bath. Looks through a telescope. Puts on eyeshadow. Stands in a forest. Cries in an empty hallway. Poses in a sexy dress. Sucks a long string of spaghetti into her mouth. Laughs. Guides two children as they throw bread to ducks in a par Points out cloud formations to the same two children. Lies in a hospital bed, holding a newborn baby. The children touch its head. Holds an old man’s hand across a table. Smiles at him. Comes up behind him somewhere else. He’s sitting. Leans over and kisses the top of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCHIE sits, head bowed, still holding SKUNK’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKUNK is alone. She looks back into the CHURCH where everybody waits. She turns back to look across the FOYER at the churches open FRONT DOOR, the garden beyond filled with sunlight.  179 118. SILENCE. She runs across the FOYER and out the FRONT DOOR, disappearing down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes open. They blink several times, eventually focusing on -

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: his head bowed. CLOSE ON SKUNK’S HAND held in her father’s. After a moment, her fingers slowly curl around his and squeeze.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: raises his head. FADE OUT.
